snippet: Raila Odinga, the second-place finisher in Kenya’s presidential race this month, filed a sweeping petition before Kenya’s Supreme Court on Saturday contending “glaring anomalies” in the vote and calling for a new election.
abstract: Raila Odinga, second-place finisher in Kenya's presidential race, files sweeping petition before Supreme Court contending 'glaring anomalies' in vote and calling for court to nullify results and order new election.
lead_paragraph: Raila Odinga, the second-place finisher in Kenya’s presidential race this month, filed a sweeping petition before Kenya’s Supreme Court on Saturday contending “glaring anomalies” in the vote and calling for a new election.

headline.main: Kenyan Court Asked to Order New Election For President
headline.print_headline: Kenyan Court Asked to Order New Election For President
